definitions.definition: Interlocking pieces of the Earth’s crust that carry oceans and continents, which float on the Earth’s partially molten mantle.
The location beneath the Earth’s surface where an earthquake begins and from which waves travel.
The point on the Earth’s surface directly above the hypocenter.
The instrument that detects vibrations within the Earth.
The record of seismic activity produced by the seismograph. Historically, drum recorders produced a visual representation of this, but is now displayed digitally.

questions.name: Tectonic Plate Boundaries
questions.definition: The Earth’s crust is in constant motion as the pieces push past, over, and under each other, causing earthquakes, building mountain ranges, and creating ocean basins. Can you find areas where earthquakes often occur? Compare where the quakes happen to the map of plate boundaries on your left.

questions.name: The Ring of Fire
questions.definition: Some plate boundaries are more active than others. The edges of the Pacific Plate form convergent boundaries as they come together with other pieces of the crust. Why might this cause frequent earthquakes?

news.title: Destruction and Tsunami After Plates Collide Again, 2017
A Look at Nepal's Progress in Earthquake Recovery, 2017
